greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = LCM of the lengths of runs of 1-bits in binary representation of n.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10922
Index entries for sequences related to binary expansion of n
example: For n = 27, in binary A007088(27) = "11011", the lengths of runs of 1-bits are [2,2], thus a(27) = lcm(2,2) = 2.
For n = 55, in binary A007088(55) = "110111", the lengths of runs of 1-bits are [2,3], thus a(55) = lcm(2,3) = 6.
program: (define (A284569 n) (apply lcm (bisect (reverse (binexp->runcount1list n)) (- 1 (modulo n 2))))) ;; For bisect and binexp->runcount1list, see the Program section of A227349.
xref: Differs from A227349 for the first time at n=27, where a(27)=2, while A227349(27)= 4.
Differs from A038374 for the first time at n=55, where a(55) = 6, while A038374(55) = 3.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Apr 14 2017
